pullRequest.title: Feature/skill rework
pullRequest.bodyText:
New Skill System:

Instead of the 5 basic skills there are now 11 skills.

10 normal skills that are used for the jobs

Intelligence which is the main driver of the leveling speed



The only way to level intelligence is at the library or when the citizens are still children at a school (next building to be implemented)


Skills are now leveled and skills themselves influence the efficiency of the workers.


Every job requires 2 of them. Those two make him work "better" and he levels up those two skills while he goes


Every skill has a complementary (Gets another 1% of xp) and a contrary skill (loses 1%)


This PR simplifies the leveling system as well by moving the skills in the building and removing the load from the view and AIs to calculate the modifiers.
Review please

commit.message: Rework citizen entity handling, should avoid fake citizens.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/version/1.15' into fixFakes

# Conflicts:

Further setup of new skill system
Basically finish skill rework and assign nw skills

nodes.bodyText: hm why are we rerouting requests through here now? and some might cause an NPE with no work building
I think this is off now, would give a child nearly capped "experience" stats, maybe set a max amount they can inherit, like 5?
hm can we make this a for loop? kinda don't like that it can get stuck depending on what ExperienceUtils.getXPNeededForNextLevel returns, incase we somehow got to the max level
this isnt needed, same as above
